00001 /**************************************************************************
00002 $Header: WN_YESNO.C Mon 11-06-2000 10:10:25 pm HvA V1.00 $

00004 
00005 #include <stdarg.h>
00006 #include "keys.h"
00007 #include "window.h"
00008 
00009 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00010     FUNCTION: wn_yesno()
00011      PURPOSE: Display an message in a window with 2 exit buttons: YES and NO
00012       SYNTAX: int wn_yesno(char *format, ...);
00013  DESCRIPTION: uses wn_dialog in the middle of the screen.
00014      RETURNS: Choise to end this dialog: 'Y', 'N' or ESC.
00015      HISTORY: 920213 V0.1 - Initial version
00016 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00017 int wn_yesno(char *format, ...)
00018 {
00019   va_list arguments;
00020   int _tmp_att;
00021   char s[132];
00022 
00023   static MENU menu[] =
00024   {
00025     {"Yes", 0 },
00026     {"No",  0 },
00027     { NULL }
00028   };
00029   int choise = ESC;
00030 
00031   menu[0].flags |= EXIT;
00032   menu[1].flags |= EXIT;
00033 
00034   va_start(arguments,format);
00035   vsprintf(s,format,arguments);
00036   va_end(arguments);
00037 
00038   _tmp_att = _dialog_att;
00039   choise = wn_dialog(13,40,2,menu,1,s);
00040   _dialog_att = _tmp_att;
00041 
00042   return(choise);
00043 }
